title: Vegetable Frittata
description: A delicious and easy frittata using leftover vegetables
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C)
Whisk eggs and milk together in a bowl
Add chopped vegetables and cheese
Season with salt and pepper
Pour into an oven-safe skillet
Bake for 20-25 minutes until set

title: Leftover Rice Stir-Fry
description: Quick and easy stir-fry using leftover rice and vegetables
instructions: Heat oil in a large pan or wok
Add vegetables and stir-fry until tender
Push vegetables to one side and scramble eggs
Add rice and soy sauce
Stir-fry everything together until heated through

title: Leftover Chicken Fried Rice
description: Transform leftover chicken and rice into a delicious quick meal.
instructions: Dice leftover chicken into small pieces.
Heat oil in a large wok or skillet over high heat.
Add onions and garlic, stir fry for 1 minute until fragrant.
Add carrots and stir fry for 2 minutes.
Push everything to one side of the pan, crack eggs on the empty side.
Scramble the eggs until just set, then mix with the vegetables.
Add cold leftover rice, breaking up any clumps.
Add chicken and peas, stir to combine.
Add soy sauce and sesame oil, toss until everything is heated through.
Serve hot, garnished with green onions if desired.

title: Cucumber Tomato Salad
description: A refreshing and simple salad that's perfect for summer.
instructions: Slice cucumbers and tomatoes into bite-sized pieces.
Thinly slice red onion.
Combine all vegetables in a large bowl.
Whisk together olive oil, vinegar, salt, pepper, and herbs.
Pour dressing over the vegetables and toss to coat.
Chill for at least 10 minutes before serving for best flavor.

title: Simple Beef Tacos
description: Easy weeknight tacos using leftover ground beef.
instructions: Heat leftover ground beef in a skillet.
Add taco seasoning and a splash of water, simmer for 2-3 minutes.
Dice tomatoes and shred lettuce.
Warm taco shells according to package instructions.
Assemble tacos with beef, vegetables, cheese, and sour cream.

title: Vegetarian Corn and Bean Quesadillas
description: Quick and satisfying quesadillas packed with protein.
instructions: Drain and rinse black beans, drain corn.
Dice bell pepper and onion.
Mix beans, corn, pepper, onion, and cilantro in a bowl. Add lime juice and seasoning.
Heat a large skillet over medium heat.
Place a tortilla in the skillet, sprinkle half with cheese.
Add a portion of the bean mixture on top of the cheese.
Add more cheese on top, then fold the tortilla in half.
Cook until golden and crispy, about 2-3 minutes per side.
Repeat with remaining ingredients. Cut into wedges and serve hot.

title: Egg Fried Rice
description: A simple and quick Asian-inspired dish using leftover rice.
instructions: Heat oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat.
Crack eggs into the pan and scramble until just set.
Add garlic and stir fry for 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add cold leftover rice, breaking up any clumps.
Add peas and carrots, stir to combine.
Add soy sauce and sesame oil, toss until everything is heated through.
Stir in chopped green onions.
Serve hot.

title: Asparagus and Tomato Pasta
description: A light and fresh pasta dish that's ready in minutes.
instructions: Cook pasta according to package instructions.
Meanwhile, trim asparagus and cut into 2-inch pieces.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add garlic and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
Add asparagus and cook for 3-4 minutes until bright green and tender-crisp.
Add halved cherry tomatoes and cook for another minute.
Drain pasta, reserving 1/4 cup of pasta water.
Add pasta to the skillet with vegetables, along with reserved pasta water.
Add lemon zest, lemon juice, and grated parmesan. Toss to combine.
Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot.

title: Corn and Cucumber Salsa
description: A fresh and crisp salsa perfect for chips or as a side dish.
instructions: If using fresh corn, cut kernels from the cob. If using canned, drain well.
Dice cucumber, tomato, and red onion into small pieces.
Finely chop jalapeño (remove seeds for less heat).
Chop cilantro leaves.
Combine all ingredients in a bowl.
Squeeze lime juice over the mixture, add salt to taste.
Stir to combine and let sit for at least 10 minutes before serving to allow flavors to meld.

title: Simple Egg Breakfast Bowl
description: A protein-packed breakfast bowl that's customizable with leftover vegetables.
instructions: Dice potato into small cubes, microwave for 2-3 minutes to partially cook.
Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat.
Add potato cubes and cook until golden and crispy, about 5-7 minutes.
Add diced bell pepper and onion, cook for another 3-4 minutes until softened.
Create a well in the center, crack eggs into it.
Cook eggs to desired doneness (scramble or leave whole).
Sprinkle with cheese, salt, pepper, and herbs.
Cover for 1 minute to melt cheese.
Serve hot in a bowl, optionally with hot sauce or salsa.
